title: Video Editing — Misleading Quality Claims
description: The buyer contracted a video editor to produce a marketing video with specific visual quality standards. The buyer argues that the video lacks the promised quality, citing evident discrepancies in clarity and color grading. The seller claims the video meets the agreement's outlined standards and blames buyer's playback equipment for any quality issues.

evidenceSpecs.name: Contract_VideoEditing.pdf
evidenceSpecs.description: The service agreement detailing the project
evidenceSpecs.content: [{"heading":"PARTIES","body":"This contract is between Aleksey Popov (Seller, Video Editor) and Carla Reeds (Buyer, Marketing Manager)."},{"heading":"SCOPE OF WORK","body":"Produce a 3-minute marketing video with 4K resolution, including color grading following BrandXYZ's style guide, and sound design according to the script provided by the buyer."},{"heading":"COMPENSATION","body":"12,000 LOB, with 6,000 LOB upfront and the remainder upon final delivery."},{"heading":"TIMELINE","body":"Draft by February 10th, 2026, with final delivery by February 14th, 2026."},{"heading":"ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA","body":"Video must be in 4K resolution, matched to the sample quality provided by the buyer, with no errors in color grading or sound sync."},{"heading":"QUALITY STANDARDS","body":"The video must maintain a minimum bitrate of 20Mbps to ensure clarity and meet the 4K specification."}]

mcQuestions.question: What specific quality was the seller required to maintain according to the contract?
By what date was the final video delivery due according to the contract?
What was included in the scope of work for the video editing contract?
According to the CSV, what action is pending as of the latest entry?
How does the image evidence contradict the seller's claim?
options: It shows the video meets the 4K resolution standard
It shows errors in the color grading
It shows a lower bitrate than agreed

analysisPrompt: Evaluate whether the final deliverable met the agreement's quality standards and determine the validity of any claimed discrepancies by analyzing the contract details, visual evidence, and timeline records.
gradingRubric:
• Identify the agreed minimum bitrate from the contract (Contract_VideoEditing.pdf).
• Verify the visual evidence of the video quality against the contract standards (VideoQualityComparison.png).
• Confirm delivery timeline and final payment status from the records (PaymentAndDeliveryTimeline.csv).
• Evaluate the seller's argument regarding playback equipment and assess its relevance.
• Determine if the discrepancies in video quality are due to the video file itself or playback conditions.
• Check acceptance criteria to see if the final deliverable adhered to all outlined standards.
